Sentencas: The physical properties of the ceramic Y0.25Zr0.60Ti0.15O2-x (YZT) and Ni/YZT cermets are presented and evaluated in terms of an application as anode substrate or anode material in solid oxide fuel cells (SOFC).
Titulo: Physical characterization of Y0.25Zr0.60Ti0.15O2-x and its performance as a Ni/Y0.25Zr0.60Ti0.15O2-x anode cermet in an SOFC

Sentencas: Cermets with different Ni content were exposed at 1000 degreesC for up to 1000 It and showed a better long-term stability in terms of electrical conductivity and microstructure than cermets with yttria (8 mol%)-stabilized zirconia (Ni/8YSZ).
Titulo: Physical characterization of Y0.25Zr0.60Ti0.15O2-x and its performance as a Ni/Y0.25Zr0.60Ti0.15O2-x anode cermet in an SOFC

Sentencas: This is explained by the different bonding strength at the Ni/ceramic interface due to the Ti content.
Titulo: Physical characterization of Y0.25Zr0.60Ti0.15O2-x and its performance as a Ni/Y0.25Zr0.60Ti0.15O2-x anode cermet in an SOFC

Sentencas: In contrast to the superior behavior as an anode substrate, the electrochemical performance of a Ni/YZT anode is significantly lower than a Ni/8YSZ anode.
Titulo: Physical characterization of Y0.25Zr0.60Ti0.15O2-x and its performance as a Ni/Y0.25Zr0.60Ti0.15O2-x anode cermet in an SOFC

Sentencas: The reason here is most likely the reduced ionic conductivity of YZT, which is about one order of magnitude smaller than that of 8YSZ.
Titulo: Physical characterization of Y0.25Zr0.60Ti0.15O2-x and its performance as a Ni/Y0.25Zr0.60Ti0.15O2-x anode cermet in an SOFC
